intro: Phaseolus zebra var. carneus, commonly known as the pink zebra bean, is a unique variant of the zebra bean species. It is characterized by its striking bi-coloration, featuring alternating pink and green stripes on its pod and seeds. This variety is native to Central America and is often cultivated for its ornamental value as well as its edible seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for both gardeners and botanists interested in its genetic and morphological diversity.
